TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed IsolatedStorageContainment extends System.Enum

Attribute.AttributeName: [System.Obsolete("Code Access Security is not supported or honored by the runtime.", DiagnosticId="SYSLIB0003", UrlFormat="https://aka.ms/dotnet-warnings/{0}")]
[<System.Obsolete("Code Access Security is not supported or honored by the runtime.", DiagnosticId="SYSLIB0003", UrlFormat="https://aka.ms/dotnet-warnings/{0}")>]

Docs.summary: Specifies the permitted use of isolated storage.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.IsolatedStorageContainment AdministerIsolatedStorageByUser = int32(112)
AdministerIsolatedStorageByUser = 112

Docs.summary: Unlimited administration ability for the user store. Allows browsing and deletion of the entire user store, but not read access other than the user's own domain/assembly identity.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.IsolatedStorageContainment ApplicationIsolationByMachine = int32(69)
ApplicationIsolationByMachine = 69

Docs.summary: Storage is isolated first by computer and then by application. This provides a data store for the application that is accessible in any domain context. The per-application data compartment requires additional trust because it potentially provides a "tunnel" between applications that could compromise the data isolation of applications in particular Web sites.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.IsolatedStorageContainment ApplicationIsolationByRoamingUser = int32(101)
ApplicationIsolationByRoamingUser = 101

Docs.summary: Storage is isolated first by user and then by application evidence. Storage will roam if Windows user data roaming is enabled. This provides a data store for the application that is accessible in any domain context. The per-application data compartment requires additional trust because it potentially provides a "tunnel" between applications that could compromise the data isolation of applications in particular Web sites.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.IsolatedStorageContainment ApplicationIsolationByUser = int32(21)
ApplicationIsolationByUser = 21

Docs.summary: Storage is isolated first by user and then by application. Storage is also isolated by computer. This provides a data store for the application that is accessible in any domain context. The per-application data compartment requires additional trust because it potentially provides a "tunnel" between applications that could compromise the data isolation of applications in particular Web sites.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.IsolatedStorageContainment AssemblyIsolationByMachine = int32(64)
AssemblyIsolationByMachine = 64

Docs.summary: Storage is isolated first by computer and then by code assembly. This provides a data store for the assembly that is accessible in any domain context. The per-assembly data compartment requires additional trust because it potentially provides a "tunnel" between applications that could compromise the data isolation of applications in particular Web sites.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.IsolatedStorageContainment AssemblyIsolationByRoamingUser = int32(96)
AssemblyIsolationByRoamingUser = 96

Docs.summary: Storage is isolated first by user and then by assembly evidence. Storage will roam if Windows user data roaming is enabled. This provides a data store for the assembly that is accessible in any domain context. The per-assembly data compartment requires additional trust because it potentially provides a "tunnel" between applications that could compromise the data isolation of applications in particular Web sites.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.IsolatedStorageContainment AssemblyIsolationByUser = int32(32)
AssemblyIsolationByUser = 32

Docs.summary: Storage is isolated first by user and then by code assembly. Storage is also isolated by computer. This provides a data store for the assembly that is accessible in any domain context. The per-assembly data compartment requires additional trust because it potentially provides a "tunnel" between applications that could compromise the data isolation of applications in particular Web sites.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.IsolatedStorageContainment DomainIsolationByMachine = int32(48)
DomainIsolationByMachine = 48

Docs.summary: Storage is isolated first by computer and then by domain and assembly. Data can only be accessed within the context of the same application and only when run on the same computer. This is helpful when a third-party assembly wants to keep a private data store.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.IsolatedStorageContainment DomainIsolationByRoamingUser = int32(80)
DomainIsolationByRoamingUser = 80

Docs.summary: Storage is isolated first by user and then by domain and assembly. Storage will roam if Windows user data roaming is enabled. Data can only be accessed within the context of the same application and only when run by the same user. This is helpful when a third-party assembly wants to keep a private data store.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.IsolatedStorageContainment DomainIsolationByUser = int32(16)
DomainIsolationByUser = 16

Docs.summary: Storage is isolated first by user and then by domain and assembly. Storage is also isolated by computer. Data can only be accessed within the context of the same application and only when run by the same user. This is helpful when a third-party assembly wants to keep a private data store.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.IsolatedStorageContainment None = int32(0)
None = 0

Docs.summary: Use of isolated storage is not allowed.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.IsolatedStorageContainment UnrestrictedIsolatedStorage = int32(240)
UnrestrictedIsolatedStorage = 240

Docs.summary: Use of isolated storage is allowed without restriction. Code has full access to any part of the user store, regardless of the identity of the domain or assembly. This use of isolated storage includes the ability to enumerate the contents of the isolated storage data store.
